column4: So I have two desktops, one is sharing files and the other is able to access all the shares except the ones on an external drive.  When I try to access these it says "Unable to mount windows share"  Can someone please help?
LordDragon; I donno, I just know thats what I used when I needed spanish characters.  http://www.tedmontgomery.com/tutorial/altchrc.html
what os on both desktops?
ubuntu 9.10 on the one sharing, 9.04 on the one trying to access the shares
how's the external connected and is it sharing over smb?
do you have another system you can test the shares with?
yeah I just tried with my laptop, ubuntu 9.04 i get the same message
I have tried unsharing and resharing too and that hasnt worked wither
smbmount //servername/sharename /mountdirectory -o username=mywindowsusername,password=mywindowspassword
its an open share do i still need user name and stuff?
nah try without it
if that fails, use a username and pass, see if it succeeds
so just smbmount //servername/sharename /mountdirectory -o
you don't need the -o
mount error: can not change directory into mount target /mnt/Videos
whats the whole command you ran?
$ smbmount //desktop/Videos /mnt/Videos
does /mnt/Videos exist locally?
no, just /mnt
create /mnt/Videos and try the command again
retrying with upper case share name
